ls.name: ls
ls.description: Returns the contents of the folder provided, or the current folder.

cd.name: cd
cd.description: Changes the working directory to the provided folder, or to the user's "home" directory.

(...).description: Executes Python code within the parentheses.

mkdir.name: mkdir
mkdir.description: Creates one or more directories. If multiple names are given, they should not be space-separated or contain backslashes.

touch.name: touch
touch.description: Creates empty files. If multiple file names are given, they should not be space-separated or contain backslashes.

edit.name: edit
edit.description: Opens a simple text editor (work in progress).

cat.name: cat
cat.description: Outputs the content of the given files.

open.name: open
open.description: Opens the given HTML/HTM file in the system's default web browser.

echo.name: echo
echo.description: Prints the provided text to the console.

calc.name: calc
calc.description: Performs a simple calculation with the provided expression.

help.name: help
help.description: outputs the comand's name, and description, like this

run.name: run
run.description: runs the comand given to it
